raw_answer:
The DNA-level mutation for patient 'AII-11' from 'Family A' is **c.1858G>A (p.D620N)**.

This is stated in the "Genetic Analysis" section on page 2: "...SPD patients and control subjects were also genotyped for **c.1858G>A (p.D620N)** mutation..."
And in the "Discussion" on page 4: "...the substitution of VPS35 **c.1858G>A (p.D620N)** occurs from independent mutational events."
Figure 1A shows Family A, with AII-11 as the proband analyzed for the p.D620N mutation. Table 1 also lists AII-11 as a carrier of the "VPS35 p.D620N" mutation.
question: Regarding patient 'AII-11' from family 'Family A': What is the DNA-level mutation? (Primary mutation)
context:
